name: Viva La Vino Wine Festival: Bangalore Edition
description: Viva La Vino – Bangalore EditionGet ready, Bangalore – after a smashing debut last year, India's coolest wine festival is back in your city with a bigger, bolder and even more fun Season 2! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari and Devati Mallick, VLV is the first-of-its-kind, a super-fun, laid-back festival with great wines + vibes, while building a wine culture that’s playful, welcoming, and totally unforgettable. Experience an evening of tasting wines with old and new wine friends in a full-on festival setting. Trust us, we will have you falling in love with the wine life all over again!What's in store this year:90+ wines from around the world: Sip, swirl, and savour a stunning lineup of international and Indian wines at your own pace. Discover new favourites, revisit classics, or surprise yourself with something unexpected. All wine tastings are included in your festival ticket.Artisan cheese: Your ticket includes a dreamy artisan cheese cup for one, so you can sip and snack at the same time. Want more? Shop extra platters and also take home your cheesy favourites.Craft chocolate: Meet India’s finest craft chocolate producers and shop their gourmet range to sweeten your evening. Wine, cheese, and chocolate are always a good idea!Taste + buy: Loved a wine? Don’t just dream about it—take it home that very night with special festival-only bottle prices.Exclusive masterclass: Get a masterclass ticket for a guided tasting of 4 premium wines not available at the main fest. A rare chance to dive deep with a cool sommelier, 25 seats only!Groovy music + poolside vibes: VLV Bangalore takes over the stunning poolside at JW Marriott Bengaluru. Their resident DJ will be spinning a banging set to keep the vibes flowing all evening.Live food stations: Indulge in mouthwatering bites from live stations curated by JW’s chefs, available to purchase on-site.Last year was a hot sell-out, and this year promises to be even bigger. Bring a friend, your partner, a whole gang of wine buddies, or come solo and find your tribe here. Just don’t miss it. See you there?

location.address: 24/1, Vittal Mallya Rd, KG Halli, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Viva La Vino
organizer.description: Welcome to VLV – the ultimate wine festival! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari (Magic Cellars) and Devati Mallick (Drink With D), VLV travels across 8 cities in its season 2 this year, celebrating wine, culture, and community. Join us for the best wines, fun vibes, and unforgettable memories..

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Basic Pencil Sketching Workshop
description: Basic Pencil Sketching Workshop - This isn’t just about sketching — it’s about slowing down, focusing your mind, and surprising yourself with what you can create.If you can hold a pencil, you can start here.Why This Event? - Always wanted to sketch but didn’t know where to begin?This workshop is designed for people who think they "can’t draw" — no experience needed. You'll learn the fundamentals of pencil sketching in a supportive, beginner-friendly space, with step-by-step guidance throughout.Whether it’s your first time sketching or you’re just looking to restart an old hobby, this session will help you understand the basics — and walk away with your own finished portrait.Duration : 3 hours (180–190 minutes)Enough time to learn, practice, and complete your first portrait with support.All basic art supplies will be provided during the session: Pencil set, Sharpener, Eraser, Blending tools, 4 sheets of sketching paperJust bring yourself — we’ll take care of the rest.What You’ll Learn & Take Away:Basics of pencil shading & stroke controlScience behind smooth blendingTools & techniques to create contrast and highlightsOne complete basic pencil portrait (made by you)Confidence to continue sketching at homeWho Can Join : Absolute beginners - Anyone aged 12 to 75 years- No prior drawing experience neededAbout the Host : Bharani Elangovan is a self-taught artist with 9+ years of experience in pencil sketching and hyperrealistic art. With a calm and clear teaching style, Bharani focuses on helping beginners understand why each technique works — making sketching approachable and enjoyable for everyone.

name: Sparkle & Shine
description: Dussehra’s behind us, and Diwali is just around the corner 🪔... Just the excuse we need to Sparkle & Shine and welcome the season of lights together!Skip the hangovers and fuel up on eggs, kombucha, mushroom shots, and good vibes as we move, groove, and dance under Pebble’s banyan tree. 🌳✨Three hours of sweat, sparkle, and sunrise magic—this festive fix is exactly what your soul needs on a beautiful Sunday morning. 🌞🪩 Bring your little ones and get their minds and hands busy with festive arts and crafts or get them on the dance floor and show them how it's done!Schedule:🦎🐆🔥9:30 – 10:15 am → Animal Flow with Sheral: Wake up your body with a 45-min session led by powerhouse fitness coach Sheral Pereira. Think primal movement meets playful sweat!🪩🎶🌟10:30 – 12:30 pm → Sparkle on the Floor with DJ Vanshi:  Hit the dance floor as DJ Vanshi spins groovy tunes to get your festive spirit flowing.And that’s not all! Our brand partners are keeping your shine going all morning:🍄 Turbo-boost your energy with Nuvedo’s functional mushroom shooters🍹 Refresh with gut-friendly kombucha or a Good Gut shot from Dads Hack🍳 Fuel up with a hearty breakfast by Pebble (included with ticket)💪 Nibble on consciously crafted super nutrition bars from Rauw⚡️ Grab 1Chaze energy drink samples from Qua Nutrition👟 Add some sparkle to your kicks with Glimmr’s sneaker charms🎃 Little ones can enjoy trick-or-treats and Spooky Art & Craft Fun with Animation Souk (included with Little Shine ticket)🪔 Get creative at a Diya Decoration workshop with MrMuffin (included with Little Shine ticket)🎟 Grab your tickets and let's shine together:✨ The Full Shine | 9:30 am – 12:30 pm | ₹2,150 Includes Animal Flow, 2 hours of dancing, breakfast by Pebble + brand samples (while supplies last).✨ Shine on the Floor | 10:30 am – 12:30 pm | ₹1,500Skip the workout and slide straight onto the dance floor. Includes 2 hours of dancing, breakfast + samples.*✨ Little Shine | 9:30 am – 12:30 pm | ₹800This ticket covers breakfast, a 30-min Diya Decoration workshop, and a Trick-or-Treat DIY Halloween arts & crafts session with Animation Souk. Entry is free.✨ Discount Codes:&Shine regular? Use SHINER for ₹100 offFirst-timer? Use NEW2SHINE for ₹200 off🌟 Good to Know:*Discounts apply only to The Full Shine and Shine On The Floor tickets** Brand samples available at entry while supplies last👧 Kid-friendly → Little Shine tickets must be purchased for children under 13🐾 Dog-friendly → Bring your pups, just make sure they’re comfy and cared for

name: Coffee and Conversations
description: What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Soumik Datta | Travellers
description: Soumik Datta | Travellers Award-winning sarod musician and composer Soumik Datta blends ambient soundscapes, spoken word, and Indian classical roots to create an experience that is both emotive and immersive. With the evocative voice of the sarod at its heart, Travellers is a sonic journey that layers field recordings and immersive sound design with live music that stretches time and pulses between memories, transporting audiences across the invisible borders that divide land, places, and people. This performance is part of Soumik’s Melodies in Slow Motion Tour, a seven-month journey across India that brings his music to concert halls, homes, heritage sites, juvenile centres, national borders, and schools, interacting with marginalised communities that often go unheard. This show is presented by Culturegrind.Credits: Sarod & Composition - Soumik Datta Violin - Sayee Rakshith Tabla - Debjit Patitundi Mridangam & Percussion - Sumesh Narayanan “Travellers” is co-produced by Soumik Datta Arts, G5A In Residence & Arts Council England.  Entry only on advance ticket booking.Seating on first come first serve basis.Gates open at 6.45 PM.NO PARKING at the venue. Parking only at Westside or Dickenson Road.

name: Qu for Quiz
description: The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided. SAMPLE Qu: 2. The name is inspired by the traditional malt whisky distillation process in which malted barley was mixed by hand with shovels. This labor-intensive process often caused a shoulder injury to workers, causing their arms to hang low. Which brand is named thus? Teams are comprised of 2 people

name: White Lotus
description: An Evening with Aditi Krishnakumar: The Real History Behind the Murder MysteryFrom merchants to teachers, from cowherds to moneylenders, our history is the story of people whose lives wove together into the sometimes inspiring, sometimes tragic, always rich and always layered tapestry of India. Join Aditi Krishnakumar, author of The White Lotus, for an interactive session on murders, the social pressures inherent in daily life, and how fiction makes history real – and leave with something that you’ve written yourself.

name: Vrindaban, Present Please
description: An Interactive play written and performed by Somudranil SarkarAbout the play "Vrindaban, Present Please" is an immersive, one-man interactive play set in a rural Indian village, where Samiran Banerjee, a Kolkata teacher, is transferred to a village school after a Supreme Court ruling. Assigned to a chaotic school once led by the mysteriously absent Salma Khatoon, Samiran's efforts to restore order only lead him deeper into unsettling events. From a water shortage to a snake in his room, his attempts to connect with the eccentric villagers only intensify his isolation. But behind it all, Samiran harbors a secret—someone named Vrindaban. Why does he hide this figure? Is it the only refuge in a world that refuses to understand him? The play unravels questions about isolation, hidden truths, and the blurred lines between personal and professional life.About the artist:  Somudranil Sarkar, a theatre maker from kolkata. He has over 25 years of experience in theatre and has had the privilege of training under some of the most respected names in the Bengali theatre circuit, including Rudraprasad Sengupta, Swatilekha Sengupta, Debshankar Halder, Sohini Sengupta, and Goutam Halder in Nandikar. He has also trained in mime under the guidance of mime guru Jogesh Dutta. Over the years, he has directed and acted in over 100 plays and curated various theatre workshops for diverse groups. Somudranil has received the Azhar Alam Young Director’s Award for his contribution to the field.

name: Making My Storybook
description: Workshop for Children by Shloka K.Colors for the characters, words for the story, plain white pages to be filled with your child’s creativity.“Making My Storybook” is a hands-on book-making workshop for parents and their 3-5 year olds. This isn’t just doodles and colors, it’s a peek into your child’s world. A world shaped by everyday observations and experiences. name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group”
description: Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R. People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 7): Off-roading on Mars
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.In our seventh lecture, we’re bringing you Nimisha Mittal, a veteran space systems engineer with over 15 years of experience at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). She led operations and testing for some of the world’s most ambitious robotic missions including the Cassini mission at Saturn, three of NASA's five Mars rovers, the Insight Mars lander, and most recently the NASA-ISRO SAR mission, NISAR. After a career of exploring the solar system, she's just completed her own mission of relocating to India. With engineering degrees from UT Austin and Stanford, she's now turning her attention from exploring other worlds to helping build the future of the Indian space industry.Her talk, Off-roading on an Alien World: Martian Tales from a Former NASA Engineer, dives into the thrill of driving robots across another planet and the bigger question of why Mars captivates us so deeply. Is it the search for life, the dream of a second home, or something even more profound? With insider stories from her time on the Mars mission, she takes us through what a day on the Red Planet really looks like, the challenges of remote space exploration, and even what it takes to earn a Martian Driver’s License.Come find out, and bring your questions — from whether humans can truly settle on Mars to what snacks power a NASA engineer through a 12-hour shift.All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar! 🍻What to Expect:A 60-minute lecture on the realities of life on the Red Planet, from exploration to insider NASA stories15–20 minutes of interactive Q&AOne Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticketA lively mixer to share your insightsEvent Details:📅 Sunday, 12th October | 4 PM – 6 PM📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for the first 10 ticketsAbout the LecturerNimisha Mittal is a veteran space systems engineer with over 15 years of experience at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), where she led operations and testing for some of the world’s most ambitious robotic missions including the Cassini mission at Saturn, three of NASA's five Mars rovers, the Insight Mars lander, and most recently the NASA-ISRO SAR mission NISAR. After a career of exploring the solar system, she's just completed her own mission of relocating to India. With engineering degrees from UT Austin and Stanford, she's now turning her attention from exploring other worlds to helping build the future of the Indian space industry.About Pint of ViewInspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand while walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: A Halloween Special with Boo! Ya Watchin
description: As a lover of all things horror, if there’s a Boo! Ya Watchin? screening you shouldn’t miss, it’s a horror film. After hosting several Halloween special screenings, including a special premiere of Longlegs with PVR in Bangalore last year, she’s back with a cult classic this month, Rec (Spanish). The special evening includes the screening of this 73-minute nail-biter (with an unpredictable ending 👀) and will be followed by a special performance by DJ Rishi Sippy, with the perfect tunes to boogie the scares away.So show up in your best Halloween costume, enjoy a movie & end your Sunday evening with a dance party! Boo! Ya Watchin?, the brainchild of Mahima. V is a Bangalore-based film screening series that turns cult classics and hidden gems into shared, immersive experiences.  REC (2007) is a Spanish found-footage horror film directed by Jaume Balagueró and Paco Plaza. The story follows TV reporter Ángela Vidal and her cameraman as they cover a routine night shift at a fire station—until a call to an apartment building turns their night into a nightmare. Shot in real-time with a claustrophobic, handheld style, REC delivers relentless tension and scares across its tight 75-minute runtime. While its intensity may not resonate with everyone, it’s widely regarded as one of the most terrifying found-footage horrors ever made.Rishi Sippy is a Bangalore-based DJ and is the brain behind beloved dance IPs in the city like Jackfruit Dance Party & Freak Opera. Rishi's performances are dynamic and immersive, fluid journeys that blend hypnotic minimalism with raw, driving energy. At Urbanaut, we're building unique and niche experiences in collaboration with our ever-present partners. Invite yourself to one — or three — or hit us up with ideas and collaborations!Ladies Who Loiter is a celebration inspired by leisure, love and art. Carefully curated by some incredible women, this is our little love letter to ladies everywhere to add more leisure, lightness, play and art into their lives.

name: Mandala Magic Workshop
description: Slow down for a few mindful hours with us as we explore the meditative practice of mandala art. In this guided session, you’ll learn to draw your own intricate, balanced patterns — one line at a time — and experience the quiet focus that comes with this beautiful, rhythmic process.Each participant will create a set of small mandalas that can be transformed into charming bookmarks, gift tags, or luggage ties — tiny tokens of calm you can carry with you.The session will be led by Usha Murthy, who has been practicing and teaching this art form for nearly a decade. Usha has conducted Dottin Mandala workshops in the U.S., and her work beautifully bridges the ancient roots of this practice — from Australian Aboriginal dot art to the Buddhist and Indian traditions of circular mandalas symbolizing life and harmony. To get a glimpse of her work, find her on Instagram @dottinmandalas.Her teaching style is gentle, step-by-step, and highly visual — a truly sensory experience. The workshop will be conducted in English, with Hindi support if needed.No prior art experience is required — just bring your curiosity and a willingness to slow down. All materials will be provided.Join us for a peaceful morning of art, conversation, and mindfulness — right in the cozy corners of our bookstore café.

name: Launch of Masala Mandi by Chef Sadaf Hussain
description: A Guide to the World of Indian Spice Blends by Karwaan Karwaan Heritage, in collaboration with Atta Galatta, invites you to an evocative evening celebrating the launch of Masala Mandi: A Guide to the World of Indian Spice Blends by chef, author, and storyteller Sadaf Hussain.This special book launch goes beyond the conventional format to bring together food, history, memory, and culture through an in-depth conversation between Chef Sadaf Hussain and Chef Deepa Chauhan. Together, they will explore the layered histories and living traditions of Indian spice blends — from ancient trade routes and cultural exchanges to everyday culinary practices that continue to evolve in homes and professional kitchens alike.Spices have always been at the heart of India’s engagement with the world, shaping not only cuisines but also economies, rituals, and identities. Through this discussion, the speakers will trace how spice blends travel across regions and generations, adapting to local palates while retaining their cultural essence. They will delve into stories of family kitchens, community festivals, seasonal rituals, and the artistry of blending spices to create distinct flavours that are simultaneously rooted and dynamic.Drawing from his extensive culinary experiences and research, Chef Sadaf will offer insights into the making of Masala Mandi—a book that documents the diverse ways in which garam masalas, pickle masalas, chai masalas, and many other blends are crafted, reimagined, and passed down. Chef Deepa will bring to the conversation her deep engagement with Sindhi culinary heritage, her journey of rediscovering family recipes, and her contemporary culinary practice that bridges tradition and innovation.Set in the warm and intimate space of Atta Galatta – The Bookstore, this event is designed to be a celebration of stories and aromas, a dialogue that invites food enthusiasts, culinary historians, home cooks, and curious readers to rethink their relationship with the humble masala. It is an opportunity to witness how history, heritage, and everyday kitchen practices come together to shape the unique flavourscape of India.

Through breath, sound and movement, you will release held emotions, awaken your Shakti and reclaim the untamed power of your feminine essence. We end this segment with dance and celebration - movement as liberation.Honouring the Feminine Lineage: A sacred ritual to honour the women who came before us - our mothers, grandmothers, and all the feminine energy in our lineage. name: Bean to Bar: Chocolate Making Workshop
description: An intimate, guided session that takes participants through the bean-to-bar journey of chocolate-making — from roasting cocoa beans to crafting and packing their own artisanal chocolate bar.Alongside, ARAKU’s coffee experts will host a brief seed-to-cup segment, showcasing a live coffee roast and brew that complements the chocolate experience.What to ExpectCrack and winnow: Work with roasted cocoa nibs to experience the texture, aroma, and transformation of the bean.Grinding & tempering: Watch a small stone grinder demo and try tempering the chocolate by hand.Craft your own bar: Add your personal touch with coffee, spices, or nuts before setting it to cool.Wrap your art :While your chocolate cools, decorate your own chocolate carton and pack your bar to take home.ARAKU coffee seed-to-cup: Learn about the journey of ARAKU coffee from seed to cup, watch a small-batch coffee roast, and enjoy a tasting paired with your chocolateWhy You’ll Love ItThis is full participation. Temper, mould, wrap, and taste every stage of your chocolate while learning the science and craft behind it. Experience the story of ARAKU coffee from seed to cup and see how it pairs beautifully with chocolate.Hosted at the ARAKU Coffee Bangalore flagship café, this session celebrates sustainability, craft, and connection from bean to bar and seed to cup.Limited seatsDate: Sunday, 12th OctTime: 10 am to 12 pmVenue: ARAKU Coffee 📍 Indiranagar, Bengaluru

description: ​Curious about growing your own clean toxin-free food but don’t know where to start?​​Join us for a hands-on hydroponics workshop where you’ll learn everything you need to start your growing journey right from your balcony.​​🌱 What we’ll cover:​​Basics of hydroponics (what why how)​​Choosing the right system for your space​​Mixing nutrients for optimal plant growth​​Plant care maintenance & troubleshooting​​Live demo and hands-on participation​​🎁 Bonus:Each participant will go home with a hydroponic self-watering house plant to get started right away.​​💸 Fee: ₹800📅 Date: Saturday October 4th🕒 Time: 3 PM – 6 PM📍 Location: Atlantis Sanctuary 👥 Limited Seats: Only 10 spots available!Only 2 wheeler parking available.Join @urbangronchain on Instagram and Twitter!

name: When Sitar Meets Yoga
description: Live sitar by Nikhil Patwardhan meets restorative yoga with Pragya Bhatt—an experience of sound and stillness. The gentle resonance of each note guides your breath and movement, quieting the mind, releasing tension, and nourishing the body. This rare fusion of sound and yoga creates a truly holistic experience—one that leaves you rested, centred, and renewed from within.About the facilitators: Pragya Bhatt is a Bangalore-based yoga and Vedanta teacher. She has led yoga retreats both in India and abroad. She is also the author two books: Beyond Asanas and In the Womb of the Goddess.Nikhil Patwardhan is a professional and performing Sitarist from India with over 30 years of experience with Sitar and Indian classical music. He belong to a family of musicians and is the third generation of musicians and Sitarists.Follow them here: @yogawithpragya & @sitarinmyheart

name: Basavanagudi Thindi walk.
description: Embark on a flavour-packed, purely vegetarian food walk through the timeless culinary lanes of Basavanagudi — a true veggie paradise nestled in the heart of South Bengaluru. They say on a food walk, the food speaks for itself, and here, every crispy bite and aromatic sip has its own story to tell.Get ready to dig into a medley of local favourites — melt-in-your-mouth khali dosa, the soft and lacey neer dosa, the ever-popular set dosa, comforting chow chow bath, indulgent damrot, classic idli-poori sagu, crunchy vada, rava idli, rava vada, and some addictive nippattu to pair with your steaming cup of tea or perfectly brewed filter coffee.And if your taste buds are still craving more, don’t worry — Basavanagudi always has room for another round of Davangere benne dosa, a crispy sagu masala dosa, or that tangy, temple-style puliyogare.Now, about where we’re eating… our lips are sealed! That’s half the fun, isn’t it?Join us for this walk, and you’ll uncover some of Basavanagudi’s most iconic and heritage food spots, tucked away in corners where time slows down and taste takes over.So lace up your shoes, bring your appetite, and let’s walk, eat, chat, and rediscover namma Basavanagudi — one bite at a time.
